snippet: The plans still call for four buildings south of Washington Square Park, but they would be shorter and smaller than first envisioned, Scott M. Stringer, the Manhattan borough president, said.
abstract: New York University agrees to reduce the scale of its plans for four tall buildings in Greenwich Village by almost a fifth; Scott M Stringer, Manhattan borough president, who has spent years negotiating with university officials to reach a compromise, says deal allows NYU to make itself more competitive with rival schools while preserving the neighborhood’s offbeat character.
lead_paragraph: The plans still call for four buildings south of Washington Square Park, but they would be shorter and smaller than first envisioned, Scott M. Stringer, the Manhattan borough president, said.

headline.seo: N.Y.U. to Scale Back Expansion Plans in Village
headline.main: N.Y.U. Agrees to Scale Back Its Expansion in the Village
headline.print_headline: N.Y.U. Agrees To Scale Back Expansion Plan For the Village
